title: Check for a Balanced Equation
text: Check if the equation is balanced or not. If not, balance the equation.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of $$CaCO_3$$
text: Use the equation $$\text{Moles of Reactant A} = \text{Mass of Reactant A} \times \frac{\text{Moles of Reactant A}}{\text{Molar Mass of Reactant A}}$$.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of $$CaCO_3$$
text: What is $$1.31 \text{ g } CaCO_3 \times \frac{1 \text{ mol } CaCO_3}{100.09 \text{ g } CaCO_3}$$? Keep three decimal places.

title: Identify the Stoichiometric Factor
text: The stoichiometric factor relating the two substances of interest is $$\frac{1 \text{ mol CO}_2}{1 \text{ mol } CaCO_3}$$.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of $$CO_2$$
text: The molar amount of $$CO_2$$ is derived by multiplying the provided molar amount of $$CaCO_3$$ by the stoichiometric factor.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of $$CO_2$$
text: What is $$0.013 \text{ mol } CO_2 \times \frac{1 \text{ mol CO}_2}{1 \text{ mol } CaCO_3}$$? Keep three decimal places.

title: Calculate the Mass of $$CO_2$$
text: Calculate the Mass of $$CO_2$$ with $$\text{Mass of Reactant A} = \left(\frac{\text{Molar Mass of Reactant A}}{\text{Moles of Reactant A}}\right) \times \text{Moles of Reactant A}$$

title: Calculate the Mass of $$CO_2$$
text: What is $$0.013 \text{ mol } CO_2 \times \frac{44.01 \text{ g } CO_2}{1 \text{mol } CO_2}$$? Keep three decimal places.

title: Calculate the Percentage Yield
text: Calculate the percentage yield with $$___$$ $$\text{\% yield} = \frac{\text{Experimental (actual) yield of product C}}{\text{Theoretical (calculated) yield of product C}} \times 100$$.

title: Calculate the Percentage Yield
text: What is $$\frac{0.53 \text{ g } CO_2}{0.572 \text{ g } CO_2}$$? Give your answer as an integer.
